qas.question: What is the ethnicity of most people living in the Marshall Islands?
What family of languages does Marshallese belong to?

answers.text: United Church of Christ – Congregational in the Marshall Islands

qas.question: Aside from UCCCMI, what is the other major religious denomination of the Marshall Islands?
From what non-Asian nation do some people living in the Marshall Islands come?
Of what ancestry are most Marshall Islands citizens?
Along with Marshallese, what is the official language of the Marshall Islands?
Of what language group is the Marshallese language?
What fraction of Marshall Islands residents are religious?
Along with the United Church of Christ and the UCCCMI, what is a main religion of the Marshall Islands?

context: The majority of the citizens of the Marshall Islands are of <a0_0><a5_0>Marshallese<a5_0/><a0_0/> descent, though there are small numbers of immigrants from <a4_0>the United States<a4_0/>, China, Philippines and other Pacific islands. The two official languages are Marshallese, which is a member of the <a1_0><a7_0>Malayo-Polynesian<a7_0/><a1_0/> languages, and <a6_0>English<a6_0/>. Almost the entire population of the islands practises some religion, with <a8_0>three-quarters<a8_0/> of the country either following the <a2_0>United Church of Christ – Congregational in the Marshall Islands<a2_0/> (UCCCMI) or <a3_0><a9_0>the Assemblies of God<a9_0/><a3_0/>.
